117628048.review:
Alright, a borderline close but no cigar review for another Winged Cloud cash grab.

The good:
The two girls are fully voiced in Japanese, which is good if you want to practice your Japanese.
The character design as usual is solid.

The meh:
The writing isn't as bad as some other WC VNs (I'm looking at you Sakura Agent), but as usual it's a lot of stretching, stalling and padding without advancing the plot.

The bad:
Too many panty shots, not enough actual naughtiness. And what's there isn't all that.
As usual, relatively important side characters like the protagonist's mom and dad are not shown. Would it really be that difficult to make two brief sketches?
There's a tarot card reading scene, but they were too cheap to actually show the cards. Seriously?
The story progresses in a logical way, until it devolves into weird cosplay episodes at the end. Guess they have a few leftover sketches they wanted to use.
No meaningful choices.
Mieko is very annoying.

Verdict: When there are so many better NSFW VNs available for free (e.g. Lunar's Chosen, College Bound, etc.), why pay for this?

114858827.review:
Sakura Swim Club is an ecchi harem visual novel set in a Japanese school. As usual, the normal Steam version is PG rated, and there's an R patch available to enable "full functionality". However, you basically end up clicking through a ton of text, with some quite contrived situation for some mildly naughty pictures (and later, more naughty pictures), and some social taboos, and occasionally make some inconsequential choices. It's a pretty boring story, IMHO. 

You play as Kaede, a new transfer student to this yet another "elite" coed academy, third one this year. You have grown apathetic to school, despite your parents' wishes and expectations, and they thought change of scenary may help. They thought wrong. And even the teacher is aware of your... reputation. He encourages you to explore some after school activities... everything EXCEPT the swim club. Naturally, you had to check it out... Where you meet Hiromi and Mieko. Technically you've already met Mieko earlier under less auspicious circumstances. Actually seems they are having a bit of a tiff now... But you are definitely interesting in joining now... But as you get to know these two beautiful girls, you may find something about yourself... 

As hinted, you end up dating them BOTH... at the SAME TIME, and both have emotional burdens to share with Kaede, so there's definitely some emotional growth, and the way both fall for the protag is believable, if slightly cliche. 

On the other hand, I personally don't believe for a second the girls would swim with that much hair untied, not that the hair ever looked very wet, even when they are in or out of the pool... 

I personally believe you can find better Sakura titles, or better visual novels, than this one. Something like... Angel Wings, for example. So you're really here for the... salacious content.

111750859.review:
(MC, Main Character, and Protagonist are all the same terms, just to avoid confusion).

Sakura Swim Club is one of the older games in the Sakura franchise, however I still find that it was an enjoyable experience. Compared to the more modern entries, the protagonist here had a higher level of depth to him (when compared to other male MCs, e.g. Succubus' MC) and it is possible to learn more about said backstory if the correct route is taken. The setting, as well as the other characters, also have decent character depth, however I would say that it is less than the protagonist. The story also does a great job of displaying the MC's mental state throughout the game, however to avoid potential spoilers I will not disclose that.
One large downside I would like to mention is that there are two specific scenes in which some good character development is given to the girls, however it is followed up by scenes that don't feel like they should be there that quickly. Perhaps other people won't be as annoyed by that part, but it took away from the story a bit for me.

Overall this entry lives up to being one of the 'Sakura Classics' and I would recommend it to anyone wanting a Sakura game with a bit more focus on the MC, as that is one of the most developed parts of the story.

107027911.review:
-If you're looking for plot, this ain't it. It's got enough plot to be a good hentai game, but not enough to be an amazing one.
-It's short but sweet, although it has a relatively abrupt ending to be honest.
-The MC is relatable... almost too relatable sometimes.
-The smut scenes are great; "interesting" yet not too invasive (most of the time) while still also being interesting enough to go back to.
-Replayability is subjective, but decent for a ten-dollar game, even though it is only a 2-hour experience.
-Romance is... interesting to say the least. Their behaviors are gradually affected in a way that it feels more natural, at least. Both waifus are kind of stereotypes, but the way it pans out in the end feels a bit pandering, and even a little forced, but you'd have to play it to get what I mean.

Overall, it's a worthy buy for any "hentai entrepreneur", even when it's not on sale. It gets a solid [b]8/10[/b]. Now, if it were something made more recently, it'd probably be a 7/10; it's a classic and if we put it by today's standards it wouldn't be that great, but seeing how it affected the western-oriented hentai romance scene, it's worthy of a 9/10.

[i]"Now, engineer child of a male gender the 9000th, you just said 8/10, where did that 9/10 come from?"[/i]  is what you may be asking; the problem lies in the patch. See, there's an uncensored patch for this game, which locks off the most important part of the experience behind a difficult paywall that isn't even that easy to circumvent even with the money needed. The only way to get the patch is to either go to old patreon page they have, or to obtain it from patching sites. 

Now, despite the fact that Winged Cloud hasn't done much other than a finger wag against these sites, I'll have to note that using them may classify as pirating. As such, I'll have to say that you [i]probably[/i] shouldn't go to sites like 'UncensorPat.ch' (*winks*) even though Winged Cloud doesn't care about it that much, even if you wish for the entire experience that isn't provided in full by Steam.

So, in the end, if the patch ever put into the main game on Steam, no strings attached, i'd give it a 9/10 overall; definitely worth buying.

P.S. The site I mentioned that you [i]probably[/i]  shouldn't go to is safe, but I can't really vouch for any sites beyond that. The patch itself is just some folders that you simply put into your game folder as per instructions, whether or not you go to patreon for it.

100364731.review:
7/10 (Long story short) campy visual novel with adult aspects that surprises you with a good story, great artwork, and lack of meaningful choices.

My takeaway: Short visual novel about a highschool boy who switches schools a lot because his dad is successful(?) and ends up finding his passion and more in a swim club. The story itself is actually very sweet and at times romantic but the very forced softcore erotic scenes are completely out of place and the type of coincidental you’d see in a campy perverted B-Movie which is a shame because the story itself is very well written and could’ve been something very moving. Also you’ll have to install a DLC to get nudity off of Steam and I’ve always found those sites to be slightly sketchy. The game is a little over an hour in length so I had to idle it to get the final card drop.

The two girls your character gets involved with are Mieko and Hiromi and neither of these girls are particularly likeable. The art in this game is actually beautiful and very well done but I can’t say the same for diversity. Mieko and Hiromi embody the same person in a different font. Mieko is a tsundere and will absolutely destroy your eardrums; looks like a brunette version of Hiromi. Hiromi is a cool headed and more dominant type; looks like a blonde version of Mieko. The characters do have some depth and have touching moments with the MC that did bring a single tear to my eye but this is completely destroyed by the poorly incorporated perv scenes with them. The times where it is incorporated well in the story can be very powerful and beautiful but I can’t say the same for the majority of them.

It is way more of a visual novel as it is a game because the ‘gameplay’ is nonexistent. The story can not and will not change depending on your choices and the only thing you can do is press your mouse to get to the next text. It does a great job at being a visual novel but it sucks that not only can you not pick the girl you want but nothing you choose really matters. I thought it did and I just somehow ended with both but after replaying it with completely different choices I realized no matter what we all get the same ending. On the bright side it is a good ending.

[u]Pros[/u]
[list]
   [*] Very smooth transitions.
   [*] Great artwork!
   [*] Soundtrack suits the atmosphere and is good.
   [*] Very well written.
   [*] There is SOME depth to the girls.
   [*] Can be both romantic and emotional.
   [*] Can play with one hand or no hands at all!
   [*] Girls are fully voiced!
   [*] Actual story!
 [/list]

[u]Cons[/u]
[list]
   [*] Your choices do not matter.
   [*] The girls look like they could be twins.
   [*] Coincidental perv moments are not charming at all.
   [*] All the drama seems very superficial.
   [*] A bit generic, you can spot what will happen a mile away.
   [*] No replayability.
   [*] I find the girls annoying.
   [*] Busted eardrums.
   [*] The extreme lack of characters make it seem like the three of you make up the whole school.
[/list]

Sakura Swim Club is an extremely basic and shameless visual novel. It knows what it is and it does that well. It's not trying to be a super deep or emotional visual novel, it tries to be a visual novel that you can just turn on and read and have a little fun with it. Yes there are 18+ patches that will allow you to view the more adult scenes in full detail, they're not great, they're just one still image but they're fine for the novel. You're not getting this game for the most gripping story ever, or the most amazing 18+ scenes, you're getting it for a cheap and quick fun night that allows you to feel something as you sit alone in your room at 2am dreaming about how nice it would be to have a girl friend. If you know what you're getting this game for, it serves its purpose. If you're getting it because you want to read an amazing visual novel, look somewhere else, probably far far away from the Sakura games.

93645749.review:
If I could give this a "Mixed" rating, I would.
This isn't a bad game. But, it's not that great either.

The writing is fine. I'd even say good. The characters, on the other hand, not so much. One of the main characters is an annoying tsundere character that I honestly didn't like, and the main character is an apathetic loner, which can work when executed well, but this character wasn't. And I'd attribute this to the main issue I have with this game: the characters' hypocrisy. The two girl characters ask the MC multiple times about something he doesn't want to talk about, but refuse beforehand to talk about their own private matters. Then, later, it's the reverse.

My second issue is that it feels like there's too little player agency. It felt like my decisions meant close to nothing, so I question there even being choices in the game.

That's about it. As I said, the writing is good. The character development is a bit cliche, but what else is there to expect from a visual novel? There's no sexual content actually in the game that I saw after laying through the story, so that tag should probably be removed. There's censored nudity, but if you came to this game looking for anime tiddies, you should look elsewhere.

Not anything I'd write home about. 5/10

88033385.review:
One of the early VNs from the Winged Cloud. It is not a yuri title which is an exception for them nowadays.

It's a relatively short slice of life VN with a bit of romance and weak comedy. It's a kinetic novel so there is only one ending despite numerous choices. It is a mixed bag story. Some comedy, some drama, some hentai scences but nothing stands out. It's not badly written but fails to leave much impression. Characters have some development but could be better. Little to no replaybility. Choices are rather meaningless and often barely differ from each other. One of the biggest flaws is that it's very formulaic and predictable. No twists or surprises at all.
 
Wanaca's art is one of the strongest points of Winged Cloud VNs. While pretty, the number of character sprites and CGs is rather limited. Completing the CG gallery is almost too easy. I guess it's justified by the price so I won't complain much here but still... Just like above, could be better.

Music is pretty average. Tracks fit scenes for the most part and some are relaxing but there are only few of them. No songs in budget titles so don't expect one here either.

No bugs ecnountered.

Overall, a quick, budget slice of life VN with a little bit of H and good art. Nothing except art stands out but worth the price asked. If you enjoy this type it's not a bad choice: 5.5/10

72163676.review:
Okay well. This one is one of their better games so far. One par with Sakura Fantasy but with a totally different genre of story.

1. The writing in this one is very good. The characters are actually somewhat deep which helps endear you to them, the scenes are not ridiculous and the overall plot flows really well. Compared to Sakura Angels and Sakura beach these girls are actually likable. Sakura beach 1&2 which was a failure of a harem story around water.... this one is much better! Also the main character actually has parents. That's a first!

2. This title is one of the ones which contains sex scenes (if you don't have the steam version). The art is very good and characters design is nice. Much better than some of the older games like Sakura Angels.

3. Story Routes. While there isn't much extra art work to be unlocked by replaying different routes.. there is a plot point regarding the main character which is only uncovered when a particular route is taken. This is the first Sakura game that has this. (I am playing them in order of publication).

4. The songs arent as jarring and loopy as Sakura Beach. They fit pretty well with the different scenes and don't sound too much like cheap MIDI files.

5. Fully voiced Dialogue (in japanese). And its well done too. As someone who went through the effort to study Japanese I always appreciate this. I'm sure budget is why not every Sakura game has voiced dialogue but it definitely adds to the experience.

70304282.review:
[h1] Overview [/h1]
Visual Novel where you follow the story of Kaede, just your average high school guy who has been moved from school to school yearly by his father, in an attempt of making Kaede find his place. Upon transferring to a new school, he meets two beautiful girls in the swim club. Things haven't gone well for the swim club lately, but with Kaede's help, that all changes.

[h1] Art Style and Sound [/h1]
The Art here is very pretty, detailed anime style.
Mieko and Hiromi could have had more expressions. the lack of them sometimes don't portrait what emotion they are trying to convey.
The UI is a pretty sight. Super in the theme of Swimming.
The tracks are in tone with the theme of the game. Not amazing, but not blend either.
Mieko and Hiromi are fully voiced, which help the game stand out more. Preety good VA may i add.

[h1] Story [/h1]
This is where it's hit and miss for me. The story flirts with brilhancy, tackling very relatable human situations and emotions, also has good humor mixed in, but the next second is just plain silly with situations, although not completly out of place, but barely beliavable! It fell like instead of flowing with the story normally, it forces itself to introduce moments for fan service, which is a damn shame, because the story overall is pretty chill! When a certain competition starts it gets more believable, more into the story, but still there it drifts in and out where concistency is concern.
There are many ways that of making an adult game/VN keeping it tastful/mature. As i pointed before in my other reviews, i do not mind sex at all, but when kept in the confines of the story, otherwise just adding it to add it only hurts the product instead of helping lift it up. I'm mature enough to not be swayed/deceived by just adding breasts/butts/boobs/sex out of sheer propose of adding them. As long as it keeps to the story, sex is a normal thing if added (kinda hot sometimes even), i just can't find it ok of a game that intends to bring a story to the player like a Visual Novel, adding senseless fan service just for the sake of "views".
If i want to look for sheer sex, there's a whole adult industry in existence for ages to look for this, or either i'll go do it myself. There are even games that are lets say "adult content focus", not trying to tell you a story or revolutionary game play, it's really just fan service. So VN's who are suppose to tell a STORY, should do just that, regardless if it include mature content or not, it should all be intrinsic to the story, always.

[h1] Gameplay[/h1]
No revolution here. Developers keep what works perfectly on VN's, pretty sure it's the Renpy engine.

[h1] Verdict [/h1]
+ Chill story, sometimes aproaching struggles for too common of human lives.
+ Mieko and Hiromi are fully voiced by great Voice Actress.
+ Very pretty and detailed game overall.
- Very unrealistic early scenarios story wise. Most happened out of nowhere. When a certain competition starts it gets more believable, more into the story, but still there it drifts in and out where concistency is concern.
- Mieko and Hiromi could have had more expressions. the lack of them sometimes don't portrait what emotion they are trying to convey.
+ Has a good ending, in which is the only scenario that is 100% believable.
+- It's enjoyable enough, as long as you overlook it's shortcomings.

[h1]On a SALE, yes, RECOMMENDED[/h1] just go with low expectations, and you'll be fine.

64512477.review: Ok, mom, firstly, you need to understand that this isn't porn, all right? It's called "hentai". Yes, that's a Japanese phrase, I'm learning Japanese from these videos. Before I get to the part about learning Japanese, though, let me first comment on the cultural implications of hentai. After the second world war, which Japan lost after the nuclear bombs were dropped on Hiroshima and Nagasaki, the entire country underwent a period of self-reflection and soul-searching. They wanted to understand how events led to the rest of the world responding with such devastating atomic attacks. This led to a strong antipathy towards war-mongering and international aggression. You may have heard about how the Japanese constitution doesn't allow the country to have an active military. Same idea. A lot of post-war Japanese culture is a reflection of such attitudes. For example, the Godzilla movies are not just about giant monsters fighting each other. They're about the horrors of unbridled atomic technology (Godzilla's always depicted as being powered by or healed by nuclear power), and how such a terrifying force can never be allowed to be unleashed on humanity again. On a similar note, Japanese animation enjoyed a resurgence of popularity after the war, due to the populace choosing to turn towards the comforting images of their youth. Japanese kids, much like kids in our country, like to watch cartoons. As a result, psychologically speaking, cartoons represent a reminder of a simpler and more innocent age. This upsurge in popularity resulted in animated images pervading almost all of Japanese culture: from movies, to television, to advertising, to music videos, and so on and so forth. And because animated images were so widely accepted throughout Japan, they were used for almost every type of source material, or to tell any type of story. Animation was no longer the sole domain of children. You got animated movies that told very mature stories, like Ghost in the Machine or Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind. Sometimes you get stories that involve very mature topics, like war, or murder, or rape, or torture. The Japanese have generally become quite accustomed seeing depictions of such things in their animations. So yeah, that's why I was watching this movie. It's an epic tale about a space crew exploring a distant planet (the crew's all female, because Japan's very into gender equality), and they run into a hostile alien, with a bunch of tentacles... and... well... I don't want to spoil the story for you, but let's just say the crew eventually figure out how to get along with the alien. It's a story about bridging cultural gaps and finding common ground. Seriously, it's worth watching. Ok, next, you remember how I talked about knowing Japanese words and phrases now? It's because these movies are subtitled in English, so I can learn Japanese while watching them. I mean, I know words like yamete, and iie, and iigu, and lots of others. Much better than just knowing konichiwa, isn't it? I mean, I'm developing such an interest in hentai that I might just major in Japanese when I'm in college. Who knows, I might be the one writing the subtitles in the future. Oh, and one last thing, you should know that hentai's considered pretty mainstream in Japan now, and it's also quite common in the western world too now. Everyone's watching it. 60542264.review:
Note: this is a review of 18+ version of Sakura Swim Club which adds a lot of new R18 CG's and extra scenes, all fully voiced. I consider this version to be a proper complete version of the VN, not the Steam's vanilla version.

Kaede who has very famous parents is expected to be a prodigy in something as well by his parents and is forced to transfer schools all the time just to trigger his "hidden talent" by changing his environment which so far has not worked that well for him. This time he transfers to a regular public high school and after hearing some rumours about a swimming club, he decides to join the club. There, he meets two beautiful girls who are the only members of the club, Hiromi and Mieko.

It is a pretty decent romance story with some very spicy scenes (only in R18 version), a lot of ridiculous situations and proper ending. It is the kind of story you can expect from a VN but it's done well enough to be enjoyable in itself. Of course, the fanservice is still the main reason why you would even read this VN and you won't be disappointed.

Both female characters are likeable. They have their own issues that will require Kaede's help to solve. I still feel that there was a bit more focus on Mieko and that Hiromi had less CG scenes but all of them were of high quality. While there were some choices you could make, I don't think they matter at all since I managed to unlock all 32 CG's during my first playthrough with only one R18 scene that was choice-bound.

Voice acting was great, both seiyuu did wonderful job, especially in those R18 scenes. Background music was fine but nothing memorable. I wouldn't buy the soundtrack if there was an option most likely.

Visuals are very pleasing and the whole gallery is pretty good wallpaper material. R18 version has 32 CG's while the vanilla version has around half of that.

Overall, I would certainly recommend Sakura Swim Club. It was one of my favourite Sakura games so far but be sure to grab 18+ patch from Winged Cloud patreon page.

55030519.review:
Fourth Sakura game I play, and second that I don't dislike. Despite it being the usual cavalcade of cliches and unrealistic scenarios, there's something strangely... wholesome  and sweet about it all.

I appreciated the protagonist's crisis and troubled relationship with his father, which bases itself on a very common kind of conflict and hers resolved in a pretty straightforward but surprisingly sweet scene.

Secondly, the girls. They're the usual one-note stereotypes, a tsundere and a kuudere with trite and poor backstories and telegraphed development, but the relationship between them (and between them and the protagonist) is weirdly cute and, dare I say, believable. I actually believe these three characters could reasonably develop into a "throuple".

Thirdly, the H scenes. You need a patch for them, and they're as unbelievable and basic as you expect them to be, but it's good to see the artist's style go full hentai.

It's still pretty bad as Eroge go, but I guess my expectations were low enough that I came out of it unexpectedly satisfied. Worth it, if on sale and if you like other Sakura games to begin with.

47759463.review:
Played this game at the right time, as far as the ending goes,
it ended during christmas, just like my gameplay.
In general, the game is great.
However, for more mature players, the 18+ patch, is a absolute need.
You can download it from their [url=https://www.patreon.com/wingedcloud]Patreon[/url] page.
Or check this guide out:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=550824660

The only real thing this game lacks, is the fact that there is few choices that really impacts the story.
All in all, its a static story line, with limited choices of 2, and with only a few encounters where you'd need to make a choice.

[b] Story line completion time: [/b]
If you read all the lines, without taking breaks, its a little over 2 and a half hour gameplay.

[b] My personal opinion: [/b]
I really enjoyed the game, also with the 18+ patch, it made a huge impact on it.
I felt that the story line was a bit static, and the choices should've impacted the story even more.
As well as added in more choices and a bit more obstacles for the main character.

[b] Opinion on voice acting/Sounds: [/b]
The overall game sounds and music fitted the theme of the game.
As far as the music selection, it was 2 tracks on repeat,
I really hoped that this game actually featured different sounds/music to each situation.
As far as the voice actors are, I felt that they put out the extra effort, and the 18+ patch also impacted by a big part.

[b] Why did I decide to play this game?: [/b]
I got it from a friend as a christmas gift, and I really enjoy visual novels in general.
When it comes to Hentai, ecchi anime, love/romanace games/series, I can't resist not to  play/watch it.

[b] Art opinion: [/b]
The art in this game is purely amazing and well drawn. Also the 18+ patch art, was purely eye candy.
The nude art was on point, however there were only so few, I really wished there were even more scenes.
But in overall, I can say that I enjoyed the art.

[b] My rating: [/b]
I would rate this game a 7 out of 10.
- Since it still lacks a lot of stuff that really seperates a okay visual novel from a great one.

[i] I don't feel that I wasted 3.3 hours on this visual novel, but rather enjoyed all of it.
I would recommend this game to people who like Visual novels, 
and who don't care too much about what I said above. [/i]

47517716.review:
Sakura Swim Club Review

A little wet and wild adventure lies in wait here…

Some key points that this game offers:

1.	Fantastic art work.
2.	Nice story line, with decent character growth.

Gameplay & Controls: 

The story plays out well enough for you to leisurely kick back in your comfy chair, hit that auto button and then enjoy the story as it unfolds before you. This time around the UI looks somewhat different than what we’ve seen in previous titles.
 
Instead of worded clickable options, this time we have icons that act as our clickable options, it’s a nice change of pace, it’s the little things after all that makes something unique. We have the same control options that we’ve grown accustomed to, LFM being used to manually move to the next scene, RMB bringing up the menu, H/ Middle Mouse button hiding the UI for those screenshots. 

Graphics:

Stunning artwork was created for this one, this time around a modern scene is given to us, scenes of a school’s interior are some locations we will be visiting along with a few other unique areas. All however have been beautifully created for us, bringing with it rich and vibrant colours to truly deliver a visual masterpiece.  The characters we meet are each created unique in their own way, the way they carry and present themselves easily describes them and paints the pictures of who they are as people and what their personalities are like. 

It will really be a pleasant journey to see how Winged Cloud expands their visual novels by incorporating moving scenes and animated scenes into their novels to bring a whole new perspective into their novels. It will really raise their bar as Visual Novel developers. On the menu side of things, we get to choose whether we want to play the game in Fullscreen or Window mode.

Sounds:

The sound for the game isn’t that great and this is not because it’s terrible, it’s too short in some scenes, especially scenes you revisit a lot, having that same melody repeat itself over and over really gets annoying at times. Something I hope they work on in future releases. Something that really makes up for the game here is the ambient sound, some scenes really have some amazing background sounds to them that really give their scenes a feeling of being alive which is quite pleasant to experience. 

Another neat add on here is the female Japanese voice acting we have for the two female characters. It is quite a fun and enjoyable add on to experience in a visual novel, however the lack of volume control for these voice overs really brings that joy down. everything feels shouted and way to loud with no way to bring the volume down unless you turn the main volume of your PC down.  On the menu side of things, we have volume control for the Ambience volume, the Music volume and the Sound volume.

Replayability:

This is an area where the game lacks again, the game has numerous choices that you can make for the main characters but besides changing a line or two of the scripts they don’t really impact the game in any way whatsoever which is really a bummer. 

It makes the choices seem useless in this regard. There is an adult patch for the game so if you are of age, I suppose you can play the game without it to experience, it as is and then download the patch to play it with X-rated content. but that is as far as replay goes for the game.

MGR Gaming’s Conclusions:
Spoilers Ahead:

Sakura Swim Club begins the story of Kaede, a young man who seems to be trapped in his father’s massive shadow with everyone having even higher expectations for him than what his already successful and famous father achieved including his father. Kaede does not feel the same way as everyone does and this has led to a divide, instead of caring to achieve better results, he simply stopped caring, which was the cause of several new school transfers in hopes of picking up his grades unbeknownst to his family the cause of his bad grades lies in a different area all together. 

This all slowly changes and improves when Kaede transfers to the latest school and joins the swim club where he meets Mieko and Hiromi; the two ladies that are going to change his life forever. Slowly Kaede’s attitude will start changing as he and the two lovely ladies grow closer and he finally realizes what it is that he wants from life.

The story reads really well, it is thoroughly enjoyable, you can see and feel how Kaede grows as a character as the story progresses, the ambient music in the scenes give the story a decent feeling of being alive which really is a nice add on. I do feel like the story should have had a few extra lines in certain scenes just to further boost and bump the story up; a good story can only be improved if one invests more detail into it. Something that I feel was a real let down is the fact that the choices didn’t really matter at all this time around, making them useless to the game itself. Last but not least the game has a few spelling and grammar errors that were never fixed.

Adult Patch:

This patch can be downloaded from Winged Cloud’s Patreon pages for free and after installing it you can start a new game to experience scenes with sexual content and full on nudity. Do note that applying this patch makes the game pretty much a full on X-rated game where it is not implied sexual content or nudity but actual sexual content such as sex scenes and nudity in its ‘nudist’ form.

Several scenes in the game will either move on to the next scene where the characters will have sex or new scripted texts will be available that leads to a sex scene.

Score 7
By: MGRza
Date: 13 September 2015

Genre: Visual Novel: Anime
Censor Rating: NSFW
Age Rating: R18
Developer: Winged Cloud
Publisher: Winged Cloud

43911761.review:
Tags: Adventure - VN - Visual Novel
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Formulaeic and cookie cutter. Mild but frequent anime art. Not much interaction. Too generic to matter. Forgettable.

This is a simple highschool VN in which you join a swim club

The girls at the swim club are adorable and immediately adopt you into their small secluded team. Then you walk on them a lot half undressed. Then they have their episode where they tell you a dramatic backstory element, become vulnerable, then after some akwardness you just all admit to each other your feelings. The three are a couple but by then you have to impress your dad by winning the swimming thing. But by then the girls helped you be better, so you win and your dad is proud. Then you have christmas with your two girls. The end.

As far as I can tell there are minor choices about your own backstory, e.g. what happened to you during your amnesia etc, but none of it really matters. The art is not really aggressive enough to really count as fan service, especially since the paperdolls feel very copy pasted by now. The main protagonist is really infantile in his mindset and behaviors, just wanting to be please everyone and not really thinking for himself much, and even sort of using the swim club as a crutch and a ritual to enter manhood by proving himself but its all very weaksauce.

Conclusion: Find something you resonate more with. This lacks a soul, and there is even some cross bleeding, such as the christmas arc at the end that ties in yet does not tie in with Sakura Santa. The occasional voice acting and frequent art was a step in the right direction though. Removed for declutter.

43186854.review:
A swimmer performing freestyle
Competitive open water swimming race
Swimming is the self-propulsion of a person through fresh or salt water, usually for recreation, sport, exercise, or survival. Locomotion is achieved through coordinated movement of the limbs, the body, or both. Humans can hold their breath underwater and undertake rudimentary locomotive swimming within weeks of birth, as an evolutionary response.[1]
Swimming is consistently among top public recreational activities,[2][3][4][5] and in some countries, swimming lessons are a compulsory part of the educational curriculum.[6] As a formalized sport, swimming features in a range of local, national, and international competitions, including every modern Summer Olympics.
Swimming relies on the natural/non natural buoyancy of the human body. On average, the body has a relative density of 0.98 compared to water, which causes the body to float. However, buoyancy varies on the basis of both body composition and the salinity of the water. Higher levels of body fat and saltier water both lower the relative density of the body and increase its buoyancy.
Since the human body is only slightly less dense than water, water supports the weight of the body during swimming. As a result, swimming is “low-impact” compared to land activities such as running. The density and viscosity of water also create resistance for objects moving through the water. Swimming strokes use this resistance to create propulsion, but this same resistance also generates drag on the body.
Hydrodynamics is important to stroke technique for swimming faster, and swimmers who want to swim faster or exhaust less try to reduce the drag of the body's motion through the water. To be more hydrodynamic, swimmers can either increase the power of their strokes or reduce water resistance, though power must increase by a factor of three to achieve the same effect as reducing resistance.[7] Efficient swimming by reducing water resistance involves a horizontal water position, rolling the body to reduce the breadth of the body in the water, and extending the arms as far as possible to reduce wave resistance.[7]
Just before plunging into the pool, swimmers may perform exercises such as squatting. Squatting helps in enhancing a swimmer’s start by warming up the thigh muscles.[8]
Human babies demonstrate an innate swimming or diving reflex from newborn until the age of approximately 6 months.[9] Other mammals also demonstrate this phenomenon (see mammalian diving reflex). The diving response involves apnea, reflex bradycardia, and peripheral vasoconstriction; in other words, babies immersed in water spontaneously hold their breath, slow their heart rate, and reduce blood circulation to the extremities (fingers and toes).[9] Because infants are innately able to swim, classes for babies of about 6 months old are offered in many locations. This helps build muscle memory and makes strong swimmers from a young age.
Swimming can be undertaken using a wide range of styles, known as 'strokes,' and these strokes are used for different purposes, or to distinguish between classes in competitive swimming. It is not necessary to use a defined stroke for propulsion through the water, and untrained swimmers may use a 'doggy paddle' of arm and leg movements, similar to the way four-legged animals swim.
There are four main strokes used in competition and recreation swimming: the front crawl, also known as freestyle, the breaststroke, the backstroke and the butterfly. Competitive swimming in Europe started around 1800, mostly using the breaststroke. In 1873, John Arthur Trudgen introduced the trudgen to Western swimming competitions.[10] The butterfly stroke developed in the 1930s, and was considered a variant of the breaststroke until accepted as a separate style in 1953.[11] Butterfly is known as the hardest stroke to many people. It burns the most calories compared to the other 3 strokes.[citation needed]
Other strokes exist for specific purposes, such as training or rescue, and it is also possible to adapt strokes to avoid using parts of the body, either to isolate certain body parts, such as swimming with arms only or legs only to train them harder, or for use by amputees or those affected by paralysis.
Swimming has been recorded since prehistoric times, and the earliest records of swimming date back to Stone Age paintings from around 7,000 years ago. Written references date from 2000 BC. Some of the earliest references include the Epic of Gilgamesh, the Iliad, the Odyssey, the Bible (Ezekiel 47:5, Acts 27:42, Isaiah 25:11), Beowulf, and other sagas.
The coastal tribes living in the volatile Low Countries were known as excellent swimmers by the Romans. Men and horses of the Batavi tribe could cross the Rhine without losing formation, according to Tacitus. Dio Cassius describes one surprise tactic employed by Aulus Plautius against the Celts at the Battle of the Medway:[12]
The [British Celts] thought that Romans would not be able to cross it without a bridge, and consequently bivouacked in rather careless fashion on the opposite bank; but he sent across a detachment of [Batavii], who were accustomed to swim easily in full armour across the most turbulent streams. . . . Thence the Britons retired to the river Thames at a point near where it empties into the ocean and at flood-tide forms a lake. This they easily crossed because they knew where the firm ground and the easy passages in this region were to be found, but the Romans in attempting to follow them were not so successful. However, the [Batavii] swam across again and some others got over by a bridge a little way up-stream, after which they assailed the barbarians from several sides at once and cut down many of them."
In 1538, Nikolaus Wynmann, a German professor of languages, wrote the first swimming book, The Swimmer or A Dialogue on the Art of Swimming (Der Schwimmer oder ein Zweigespräch über die Schwimmkunst)
There are many reasons why people swim, from swimming as a recreational pursuit to swimming as a necessary part of a job or other activity. Swimming may also be used to rehabilitate injuries, especially various cardiovascular and muscle injuries.
Many swimmers swim for recreation, with swimming consistently ranking as one of the physical activities people are most likely to take part in. Recreational swimming can also be used for exercise, relaxation or rehabilitation.[13] The support of the water, and the reduction in impact, make swimming accessible for people who are unable to undertake activities such as running.
Swimming is primarily a cardiovascular/aerobic exercise[14] due to the long exercise time, requiring a constant oxygen supply to the muscles, except for short sprints where the muscles work anaerobically. As with most aerobic exercise, swimming reduces the harmful effects of stress. Swimming is also effective in improving health for people with cardiovascular problems and chronic illnesses. It is proven to positively impact the mental health of pregnant women and mothers. Swimming can even improve mood.[15]
As of 2013, the Americans with Disabilities Act requires that swimming pools in the United States be accessible to disabled swimmers.[16]
"Water-based exercise can benefit older adults by improving quality of life and decreasing disability. It also improves or maintains the bone health of post-menopausal women."[17]Swimming as a sport predominantly involves participants competing to be the fastest over a given distance. Competitors swim different distances in different levels of competition. For example, swimming has been an Olympic sport since 1896, and the current program includes events from 50 m to 1500 m in length, across all four main strokes and medley.

The sport is governed internationally by the Fédération Internationale de Natation (FINA), and competition pools for FINA events are 25 or 50 meters in length. In the United States, a pool 25 yards in length is commonly use

40950381.review:
Love them or hate them, it can't be denied that Winged Cloud made a pretty big mark on Steam with Sakura Swim Club.  I'm not sure if it THE first eroge on steam, but its pretty close to it.   

Everyone knows Winged Cloud at this point.  The Sakura visual novels are multiplying like rabbits.  With Renpy, visual novels are cheap and easy to make.  Sure you're not gonna get the next <insert critically acclaimed VN here> out of Winged Cloud, but that doesn't mean their visual novels are bad.  They set out to do one thing.

The story is pretty generic: new kid in school, joins the swim club, befriends two girls, and they eventually fight for his affections.  The "twists" in each character's story is pretty laughably bad.  

The voice acting is weird, but only because its in Japanese and the game was made in English, so its just a weird juxtaposition.  Otherwise the voice acting is fine.  The music is standard issue visual novel fluff.  The "comedic" music is kind of annoying, but fortunately doesn't show up too much.

The art is Wanaca.  Thats all I need to say.  A lot of people take issue that Wanaca has a same face problem, and its more or less true.  I like her art, so it doesn't bother me.  I swear Mieko was totally reused as Ceri in Sakura Dungeon though.  CG scenes are pretty frequent, but theres not too many.  With the uncensor patch, you'll have to replay the game once to get all the CGs,  Its pretty obvious where the choice is.  

So how is Winged Cloud's first venture into eroge?  Its not bad. I enjoyed the story.  The game isn't too long.  Not something I'll be playing again anytime soon.

40239732.review:
Empecé esta novela por que quería aprender a nadar, ya que uno siempre debe estar preparado, pero me encontré con algo diferente y la verdad me sorprendió.

El protagonista (Kaede) es alguien que cambia de escuela cada cierto tiempo, ya que no quiere cumplir con las expectativas de su familia ni de la gente, pero un día entra en una escuela que tiene un club de natación (al cual todos le dijeron que no fuera) y se encuentra con dos lindas chicas, Mieko y Hiromi. El juego empezó cumpliendo mis expectativas, ya que en la primera sesión de nado te dan un consejo muy valioso, respirar adecuadamente es importante.

A lo largo de la novela los tres personajes se irán conociendo e irán fortaleciendo lazos (además de los huesos...) llegando al punto donde crean un vinculo emocional que va más allá de la amistad. Esta obra trata sobre la superación personal ya que en el club de natación Kaede encontrará un propósito y es nada menos que ganar la competencia nacional.

También la novela nos enseña el valor de la competitividad, ya que Hiromi y Mieko empezarán un enfrentamiento por el amor del protagonista, pasarán de una inocente batalla de cosplays a pensar en ganar la competencia nacional para invitar al suertudo a una cita. El valor más importante que muestra esta obra literaria interactiva sin duda es la amistad, las chicas dejan a un lado la rivalidad para demostrar cuanto se quieren, juntando sutilmente sus labios culminando en un tierno beso bajo el agua, fue un cuadro tan hermoso que cualquiera pensaría que fue pintado por da Vinci haciendo una oda a la belleza de las sirenas.

Esta novela es milagrosa ya que me devolvió el espíritu navideño, Santas Boobies te trae un hermoso regalo, creo que Santa no se esfuerza como antes porque el regalo venía semi-abierto, por lo que fue fácil de abrir... pero las costumbres no se olvidan así que como no tenia galletas solo le di la leche.

La duración del juego depende de la fortaleza mental de cada uno... tengo 0.1 h pero no piensen mal, no es por eso, tenia el juego pirata y ahí tenia unas 25 horas. Sin dudas una novela visual tremenda 10/10

39145657.review:
-Spoiler free-
Finally jumping into the VNs I got during the winter sale, I decided to try Sakura Swim Club first. I've heard many things about the Sakura series but this is my first delving into it. And honestly, I was disappointed.

The story revolves around a high school student with over the top rich parents who send him to school after school that he doesn't care enough to put the effort into. At least until he finds one with a rather infamous swimming club. Learning how to swim with two very curvacious women in tight swimsuits motivates a high school kid, go figure. It has some very strong points but is overshadowed by one thing; the breasts.

I have no issues with fan service or nudity or breasts, that should be obvious since I play so many eroge type games. The reason this VN has an issue with breasts is because every single time you think the characters are going to get flushed out or some bit of a rather dark past will be revealed, it just never happens. Instead, someone trips and somehow manages to throw all of their clothes off and just barely cover their nipples with some random object or some wind hikes up their skirt and they can't help but just bend over and show everything off to the world. And then, of course, the protagonist is shamed and called a pervert for happening to be in the general area when it happens although he never seems to give a rat's ass about any of it.

Seriously, this really killed what would otherwise be a kind of interesting, albeit rushed, visual novel. You kind of have to chose which kind of VN you want to be; one based around fan service and sex or one based around story. You have have elements of both, but you can't try and be both at the same time. It just makes the whole experience awkward.

The artwork is appealing but the characters shift back and forth while talking and the CG lacks any kind of change in expressions during dialogue. In fact, it's not uncommon for characters to look really pissed off when the atmosphere suddenly changes because they haven't gotten another line of dialogue yet and the developers couldn't be bothered to animate more than one character changing expressions at a time.

I give Sakura Swim Club a 3/10. This VN has bits where I find myself wanting to dive straight into the story only for tits to suddenly take the center stage and knock me straight back out. And yet I can't just enjoy the tits for what they are because none of the situations seem believable or make any sense and just come out of nowhere.

Maybe the rest of the series has some quality, but I can't be bothered to try and find out after this one.

Tremenda VN, me encantó de principio a fin. 
Antes tenia la mala idea de no comprar novelas en steam por el tema de la censura y que usualmente las que estan acá son muiy seleccionadas, pero esta cambio por completo mi vision sobre steam respecto a esto. 

La historia acá se nos es contada desde la perspectiva de un chico llamado Kanade, el cual al tener un padre tan exitoso en la vida siempre a tenido que vivir a sus sombra, sin la posibilidad de decir que es lo que quiere hacer y siempre siguiendo las ordenes de su padre por las altas expectatrivas que tiene en su hijo Kanade. Esto hace que entremos en una especie de deprecion y apatia por todo lo que nos rodea, dejando la escuela a un lado y simplemente que no nos importe nada. 
Todo esto cambia cuando al llegar a su nueva escuela se une al club de natacion, en el cual conoce a las 2 heroinas de esta historia; Hiromi y Mieko. Estas dos chicas a traves del desarrollo de la historia nos ayudaran a recobrar el autoestima y la valia para que Kanade se revele en contra de su padre y al fin pueda decirle todo lo que se ha estado guardando a lo largo de todos estos años. 
Una premisa bastante sencilla, pero que es llevada a cabo bastante bien.
Las 2 heroinas son un amor, a pesar de que la historia no nos cuenta mucho sobre su pasado, solo ciertos detalles, es mas que suficiente como para enamorarnos de ellas. 
En lo personal hay algo que me deja con un mal sabor de boca y es referente a Hiromi... sin embargo, no es algo que te arruine la experiencia. Una vez que juegues la novela sabrás a lo que me refiero si eres perspicaz.

- Hay parche para ponerlo al español en caso de que no sepas ingles o simplemente tienes ganas de leerla en español. 
- Hay parche para pasar a la version sin censura.

As a graphics novel, it falls short on both accounts.

Graphic part: upon completion, you get less than half a dozen explicit images, none of them artistic or otherwise interesting in any way; granted, that is subjective, but the small quantity remains a fact. 15 seconds of Googleing will give you better, and more.

Novel part: full of mistakes, ie. typos (lots!), contradictions and inconsistencies in the course of action; characters undeveloped and utterly unmotivated.

36340178.review:
Sakura Swim Club was released on 9/11, and such a date is no coincidence. The game itself serves as a sombre reminder of the event

Oh boy. What a way to start into my first game in the Sakura series. By this point I’ve grown pretty used to playing these games that are more aimed towards men, and this series really takes it to the extreme. Sakura Swim Club is the latest release in the (monthly?) series of Sakura titles on Steam.

In Sakura Swim Club, you, as the reader, are in the role of Kaede. Kaede is your typical boring guy who comes from a family of prodigies. Of course, he doesn’t care enough to do well in school. His father keeps transferring him to different schools every semester, hoping to find one that will finally “click” so Kaede will follow in his footsteps. With his latest transfer, he bumps into (quite literally) a girl. Later, he goes to check out the swim club and finds out this girl is a part of this. This begins his long journey to make it to the tournament where he decides to prove to his dad that this school is working for him and he doesn’t want to leave.

Now, for those unaware, the Sakura series isn’t exactly known for having a serious plot. If my experience with Sakura Swim Club says anything, it doesn’t seem to have a very realistic plot either. The main focus is on how dirty it can become. Don’t worry – the base Steam version is censored. You won’t really “see” anything. This doesn’t take out all of the near nakedness or panty shots though.

Going into Sakura Swim Club, I knew what to expect from it. I knew that things were going to get a bit risqué. It still would’ve been nice if there was, say, an actually tangible plot line. The “plot” makes basically no sense. Often times, things would happen just so the story could go completely off and have a lewd picture happen. Oh hey look, we’re at a cultural festival! The MC has no idea what this even is, but the girls force him to go just so that they can go and show him these lewd swimsuits/outfits.

Sakura Swim Club is definitely aimed at a particular kind of audience. If you’re wanting to read a serious visual novel then there are plenty on Steam I might suggest instead of this. If you want a pretty nonsense story that just throws in events so that one can get more lewd pictures in then sure, maybe the Sakura series is for you. I also spotted some typos within the writing which didn’t help with how much the story was already making me laugh from the nonsense within. With how much nonsense I found in the story, it’s hard for me to recommend this. It was already a particularly hard recommend because it’s aimed at such a specific audience, but the absolutely nonsense story and events happening just to get into a lewd picture push it past the point of non-recommendation.

Sakura Swim Club is very similar to other Sakura games. Despite all the fanservice thrown in CG form, there’s always a human emotion aspect that’s relatable. This game has an ongoing theme that it’s better to be yourself deciding what you want to do instead of having the path of life decided for you ahead of time against your choosing.

Sakura Swim Club, like Sakura Angels, got a free voice patch after release. The voices fit the characters well and amplify the reading experience quite a bit.

Describing Sakura Swim Club is difficult, not because of the game, which is fairly flat and straightforward, but because it was meant for adults and must be carefully tip-toed around for proper reviewing. A simple and short visual novel, it follows the story of 'Generic Guy' as he adjusts to a new school environment. His problem? He's unmotivated and uninterested with the world. Forced to pick a club GG opts to go for the swimming club; a club that consists of only two female members and has developed an infamous reputation. Upon arriving he meets up with 'Tsundere' and 'Sweet Girl,' and various things start to follow.

This visual novel is not good. The primary reason is because it was meant for one purpose and one purpose alone. As a result the characters are flat, and the story is little more than a token piece meant to tie everything together - often tripping over itself in order to add comedic and "romantic" moments at seemingly random times. At one point, for example, GG has 'Tsundere' and 'Sweet Girl' over at his house when the later one notices that GG has a game console. In her attempts to utilize it certain hijinks ensue that seem impossible for multiple reasons, and were clearly included simply to have said hijinks.

As a visual novel it ends up being quite lacking, as the choices are, few and almost never all that deep (at best). There is a bit of a plot and story involving GG and how he will adapt to the new school and handle his overbearing parents, yet it's never all that tense and the conclusions are fairly obvious. The plot is flat with no real twists or turns, the characters are archetypes through and through, but at least, if there's one redeeming feature that is that, as a piece of a certain… genre, it's decently acceptable.

While clearly not on par with more thought out pieces and certainly underwhelming, there isn't actually something 'wrong' with Sakura Swim Club. The art is decent enough, the story, while clumsy, is not really the main focus, and the characters, while obvious recycled clichés with little deviation, are also not really bad or all that groan-worthy. The problem is that it targets a specific niche and makes no attempt to deviate from it, become deeper, or even try a bit harder. While that does keep it from becoming frustrating, it also means that it's simply flat through and through. It has one place and it is more than glad to stay there.

35658777.review:
I don't ask that much from my ecchi visual novels. I am aware that the goal of those simple experiences is to indulge in the clichés you love in anime... But I do have some minimum standards.

1) I want the characters to have a coherent basic personality (even if it's a cliché like "tsundere", "shy one"...). The fanservice scenes have to fit the personality of the girls in order to work.

2) I want the choices I am given to have some kind of influence. Changing two lines of text does not count : I want either different scenes, or callbacks to my previous choices later.

Sakura Swim Club did NOT provide those two basic things.

Yes, the art is nice, and it has voice acting. 
...But I was bored to death. There was no plot point that suprised me or gave me a reason to feel any tension, and the behavior of the characters seemed illogical at times. I just couldn't get into it.

I know I am being subjective here. But even if I forget my boredom with the hyper-conventional story, the two problems mentionned before are still here. This means this game is objectively subpar. A good VN wouldn't give you choices if they don't change anything.

Maybe if you are REALLY REALLY into swimsuits you can overlook all this because titties. Personally I think there are just way better options to get your fanservice fix than this linear story that has too few ideas and clumsy writing, even by ecchi visual novel standards.

Long story short : give this game a pass. There are just so many better choices. 

When it comes to visual novels about swimming, you can find great stuff in Japanese. 
And if you don't speak it, you can always look at the Kimi ga Nozomu Eien (Rumbling Hearts) series, which has been translated, and has lots of swimming in it.

35428192.review:
Where should I start this review at, maybe the artwork. The artwork is that of a game I have never seen before, the shading on each of the characters was done so well it seems as though these 2d girls were 3d, not to mention the wonderful scenery and great hud. 
The gameplay was very in debt and was very immersive, it was as if I was playing this game with an oculus rift and one of those vr treadmills. When I was playing this game I instantly knew this would hit top 5 of my favorite games, along with games of the likes of Knack 2 and Yooka laylee. The gameplay is very fluid and character movement is quick, this game is not for slowpokes!
The story was wonderful, this game had a 48 hour story along with 72 hours worth of side quests and 60 hours worth of dlc story. The main story brought me to tears, made me life, and brough me to the verge of clinical depression so many times that I feel it is worth mentioning how GOOD this story is. Your 3 main characters are well developed throughout the story and you can connect with them very well. The Side quests make you feel as if your involved with the various communities that are in the game such as White Run and the NCR. Doing meaningless tasks for people I don't know never felt so immersive. Then the dlc content was the icing on the 3 layered chocolate frosted moose filling ice cream with whipped cream cake, the new areas added along with the dlc content give you more to do after you have done everything to do that is in the game, even after collecting all 100 golden skulltulas.
The community for this game is no nice and kind, I have never once been matched with salty/angry people. Whenever I play ranked games or even just casual matches I always enjoy talking to my team because they never once are rude or angry to me. The modding community adds the sprinkles on top of the cherry because now you have over 1000+ hours worth of gameplay to add to your game. I especially love the modded weapons!

All in all my review for this game is [spoiler] 2/10 BECAUSE SWIMMING PHYSICS SUCK .[/spoiler]

And so forth.



The best way to decide if you will enjoy Sakura Swim Club: In one section of the story, Kaede (the protagonist) invites his friends over to play on his console. Except one of them trips over the cord, gets tangled in it and the tangles tie her up in a knot while simultaneously pulling her skirt up and her bra down, so the other girl tries to help and she gets all tangled up as well.   Do you think this sounds hot? Buy Sakura Swim Club. Do you think this sounds lame and off-putting? Skip it. 


Giving it a yes vote because what it does, it does well. But it is short enough suggest waiting for a massive sale as the full price is too much for what you get.

They actually attempted a narrative, but it's hilariously misguided. 

The best way to craft a story containing smut is either treat it seriously or, if you don't have the skill to do that, you can just write it tongue-in-cheek. This game and the Sakura games I've played are absolutely inept at writing a story, but take the narrative to levels of such desperation for character development, that they can deal with real death in the middle of hentai scenes. 34856132.review:
This 6th title of the Sakura series from Winged Cloud feature a male protagonist Kaede who transferred to another high school after numerous transfers due to poor grades in different schools and his parents having to move constantly. Upon his arrival at the new school, under the encouragement of a teacher, he decides to join an under-represented swim club in the school that only has two girls Hiromi and Mieko as its members. Over the course of this visual novel, Kaede would gain the drive and commitment to swim for the school's swimming team, the love and attention from Hiromi and Mieko and his father's support to allow him to continue his studies and training at his current high school.

The story and plot is written like a romantic comedy with a share of humour and fanservice. There are more than 1500 positive reviews at the time of this review, nice soundtracks by REN from the circle 'Bastat tail' and great artwork by Wanaca. Recommended for fans of Winged Cloud who might be interested in collecting the titles in the Sakura series and the great artwork in the trading cards, badges, emoticons and profile artwork in this game and when at discount or bundle offer as it takes less than 10 hours to read through the visual novel and unlock all CGs.

34812959.review:
I got this in a humblebundle and it was first Sakura game I've ever tried. The game is censored until you go to the creator's patreon and download a patch. Don't worry, it's free you just have to download it and put it in the right folder. Now that that's out of the way, let's get down to the actual game. 

Well, it's not the worst thing I've ever read. I'd give it a "decent at best" rating, though the art is pretty well done. Story is that you're some kid who barely scrapes through school because they don't care and his family has bigger expectations than that. He ends up joining a swim club where the only other members are 2 girls. They both end up falling in love with him even though he has little personality. Most of the choices in this game lead to the same thing no matter what, except for one that changes where your character aims by a few inches if you catch my drift. 

It's not something I'd say is bad, but I'm not sure I'd recommend it $10 either. Artwork is pretty good, story is meh, maybe consider picking it up on a sale? It's one of the few VNs I've seen have butt stuff in it, if that's your thing.

33625077.review:
I gotta say, I'm no fan of anime, but this is pretty stellar. The shooting, driving, and crafting are all very innovative and fit well within the gameplay. No mechanic feels out of place. Sakura Swim Club is possibly one of the finest FPS experiences you'll ever have. My favorite weapon is the BFG, personally, but Half-Life 2's weapon selection is still very top notch. The toughest part of the campaign I have to say though is definitely End of The Line, known more notoriously as the 'Train Mission'. You have to sneak through the ruins of Pripyat as the S.A.S. and kill this Russian guy. Though it does really pick up once you fight your first dragon. Although I'd say Starbound's biggest flaw is the lack of good music. The score in Quake II is honestly quite tiresome, and the game has a habit of repeating the same tracks over and over.

Overall, I'd give S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl a 7/10. It's a great game if you can get past the irritating soundtrack, and I can't wait for the sequel, Wolfenstein: The Old Blood.

31854874.review:
I can't say that I like this game. But I don't DISLIKE it. Hear's what I mean:

I started off in my VN ventures with Muv-Luv. Probably sooner, but that's my personal favorite. So rating this game next to that is unfair, but besides the point. 

I can live with the pointless fan service. I can deal with stories that lack depth. I can even deal with the repetitive blatant ignorance of the MC (which is commom among these type of games). But what I hate most is how LINEAR it is. No matter what option you pick in this game, it all leads to the same ending with slighty different dialogue hear and there. And that's disappointing. What about my choices? Why do they have no effect in how the game progress? If I wanted to experience a linear story, I'd watch anime, or read manga. What's the point of even giving you options? You might as well just smash the ENTER button for 3 hours, since what you choose makes no difference anyway. 

So with that, I'm gonna have to give it a thumbs down. If you like this game, recommend it to whoever, but I'm sorry, because I can't do the same.

31081201.review:
[i]Sakura Swim Club[/i] : Es la Quinta Entrega de la Saga "Sakura". En donde seguiremos la historia de Kaede, un chico introvertido que no tiene ni idea de que hacer con su vida. Al ser ademas el objeto de observación de sus padres, quienes esperan de el resultados productivos que lo puedan conducir a un futuro prospero, para así lograr convertirse en una persona famosa.

Pero, siendo este consciente de sus intenciones, prefiere vivir una vida defraudando a quienes esperan de el buenos resultados. Después de haber pasado por varios institutos sin poder complacer a su padre. Nuestro protagonista llega de nuevo a una nueva escuela, donde conocerá a dos chicas hermosas en el club de natación.

[i]"Llevando así después a percatarse de que las cosas no han ido bien para el club de natación últimamente, pero con la llegada de Kaede, se espera que todo cambie."[/i]

A partir de este punto, comienzo la trama del juego, su dinámica es consecutiva a los demás juegos, el Ecchi sera el genero predominante en esta novela visual. Un dato curioso que sera novedoso para algunos es que esta entrega contara con el contenido [i]"Hentai"[/i], con el cual puedes hacerte buscando en Google, ya que es muy bien sabido que Steam censura esta clase de material. Sin que falte mencionar que podremos contar con un [u]Parche En Español.[/u]

Presenta una historia simple al igual que la asistencia de su banda sonora, los diálogos son sencillos y los lugares en donde se desarrolla la historia como lo es la escuela, la piscina, las habitaciones y todo lo demás también por igual, pero el diseño e ilustración de sus personajes es un dato que de verdad me dejo pasmado.

La Historia es sencilla, pero muy entretenida, al igual que los demás aportes mencionados. Debo resaltar que su simpleza no disminuirá el talento de este juego, al contrario, son estas cosas las que definen a las Novelas Visuales y son la razón por la que decidimos divertirnos con estos juegos.

En esta novela tendremos la disponibilidad de tomar decisiones, pero que no alteraran mucho la historia, ya que solo existe un final, pero de ellas, en algunas ocasiones podemos disfrutar de los tradicionales "Momentos Críticos De La Novela" al estilo Moe. 

[h1] POR OTRO LADO [/h1]

Quisiera ademas hablar un poco de al menos dos personajes por los cuales creo que son los que mas lograron llamarme la Atención.

[b]Kaede :[/b] Quien ademas por ser el protagonista, es un personaje introvertido quien concibe y reflexiona mucho acerca de las cosas mas simples como las relaciones, los padres, y el mas importante de todos : "Que Hacer Con Nuestra Vida", lo que me parece un trastorno que muchos de nosotros compartimos y que en el transcurso de esta historia me pude identificar en varias partes.

[b]Hiromi :[/b] Una belleza sensual en todos los sentidos, en cuerpo y en personalidad, creo que al identificarme con el protagonista, y que haya una chica como ella aconsejando a alguien quien es por parte un espejo de mi personalidad, me hizo darle mucho cariño.

Y Bueno, Termino Con Esto, Francamente es una buena novela gráfica, recomiendo esta novela para quienes deseen pasar el rato, su tiempo estimado es de 2-10 horas dependiendo de la velocidad con que quieras avanzar los diálogos.

Espero Que Este Análisis Haya Sido De Tu Agrado.

Now, they are rivals trying to win his affections.

Eventually, Kaede finds what he is looking for, a place to belong... and love.

This visual novel is nothing short of an embarrassment.

The story pacing is all over the place, girls in this story have boobs large enough to collapse in on themselves, you could easily remove chunks of the game and have no difference in the story, and I came out of this game more confused than when I went in. 

The "Choices" You make through the game have very little or no change on the actual story. Not to mention the fact that you only have two choices and they don't appear for every ten or so minutes. Even then you can't pick choices you even care about, the game automatically forces you to date both girls anyway.

Speaking of which, both of the girls fall in love with you but they do as such miraculously at the same time, for reasons that make absolutly no sense nonetheless, regardless of the fact that they know next to nothing about you. Supposedly they're very smart yet disprove this by both agreeing to date the main character at the same time: Again showing that they have no personality. Or at least the personality they do have is torn in half and thrown under a bus by the time they fall in love with you.

Moving on: The dad, whose only purpose in the story is to talk to you on the phone and stall time so that the days don't feel so close together. Later in the story changing that purpose to becoming a temporary antagonist, telling his son he has to move. Which I, as the player, do not care about because the main character is practically brain dead anyway for chosing two girls rather than one like a normal fucking human being. For those people who DO care though, don't fret as this only last for about five minutes going a little something like this;
-"Girlfriend 1, girlfriend 2, I'm retarded so my dad is making me go to another school"
-"What? Noooo. Call him back, tell him no."
-"Okay."
Calls the dad back.
-"Shove off, Dad, I'm staying."
-"Pfft. Alright."
WTF is happening?! Obviously, these aren't the exact lines but they're not that far off so it doesn't even matter. I can't even make up a story this bad. I can't, I really can't, beyond that I don't even WANT to make up a story this bad. It's that bad. That's all this stupid visual novel is! I had to turn my brain off in order to keep playing half way through. Do I even need to talk about all the absolutly forced fan-service? I'm all for it, as long as it doesn't get in the way of the good stuff, but in Sakura Swim Club, or whatever this crap is called. Don't even know if that's right. Here though, you have fan-service up the ass, walk into a room with a girl in order to study so you don't fail at life? NOPE! She's stripping now? Okay. "This is stupid" Shut up brain.
Oh! How about that one moment? You want to play videogames with a girl? NOPE! The controller, inexplicably, has a magic fucking cord. Managing to not only strip one of the girls, somehow, but wrap around her body and tighten into some weird BDSM kink fantasy. At least it was kind enough to cover her nipples though, that silly controller cable.

It saddens me, it really does. The girls of this game have some really good designs, and Himori has an awesome personality for the first half of the game. It just sucks that this game waste their potential by trying to force itself. For the most part, this isn't even a visual novel. It's a poorly written book with fan-service drawings every few pages and the ability to, slightly, change a few dialogues here and there. Though not perfectly, I feel like this visual novel wouldn't totally suck if it just gave you the option to chose which girl you want to date rather than being forced to date them both. 

Now for the twats out there who skip to the end of my review. My score in a nutshell: 3/10

25833655.review: All the sakura games are such clickbaiters with their beautiful way of how to show human bodys in a art form filled with emotions. Sakura Spirit is a 2014 visual novel developed by Winged Cloud and published by Sekai Project. The game was released on July 9, 2014 on Steam and MangaGamer. It is one of the few visual novels that are developed outside Japan and aimed at the English-speaking market. It is also one of the first projects published by Sekai Project that is not a translation of a Japanese visual novel, but rather an original English work. The game is a visual novel where the player reads text on the screen combined with anime-styled artwork. However, unlike some other visual novels, Sakura Spirit does not allow the player to make selections (except for one at the end), which normally allows the visual novel's plot to progress in the direction of the player's choice. Overall Sakura Swim Club is a must buy for any japanese artwork lover (anime) at its best.

23924117.review:
tl;dr: If you like Visual Novels, don't get this!

If you love japanese VNs and have played the really great ones like Muvluv (freshly available on steam!), Fate/Stay Night, Steins;Gate and Grisaia no Kajitsu, you will be looking for VNs with a really phenomenal story.

This is not it!

The story is generic and nothing special. It's basically a harem game from the beginning. The two swim club members want you to join, so the club won't be shut down.

The pacing of the story is very bad. Everything happens too fast, there is almost no buildup between the "happenings", and they somehow open up to you much too quickly. Feels really unnatural.

The only good point of this game are the graphics. But sadly that's all there is.

If you like quality Visual Novels don't buy this.

I hope you know how to swim or else you will drown in the pussy ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) 


Ah Sakura Swim Club you have been the bastard child of my reccomended for me list for so long now. But it wasn't until now that I caved in and bought it thanks to the summer sale.  But is it any good or should it of been drowned in the development stages?

Well I went into SSC with high expectations as the only VNs I had played before hand was the Nekopara and because of this I ended up coming out a bit disapointed. In regards to plot well there isn't really any I mean it's a hentai I game I get it but at least Nekopara was able to create a story with varying character arcs that could also lead to sequel games but eh. The protagonist is called Kaede and honestly he has about as much personality as a cardboard cutout of the WWE wrestler Roman Reigns. He transfers to a new school and looks for a club to join he stumbles across the swimming clubs and after a hasty start with its members eventually becomes romantically involved with the 2 members of the club. 

Honestly if you have seen any school anime you have seen this kind of story before, they try to make it emotional and act as if the 2 girls actually have character but after the touching moments the character development seems to go out of the window and the matters discussed no longer effect the 2 girls at all. Honestly though the story comes across as cheesy and I found myself actually laughing at some of the predictable tropes that occured in the story to the point where I see its cheesiness as a good thing. There is also now a Japanese dub for the girls in the gae and honestly the VO is great I would sah

Ah yes I may as well talk about the girls whilst I am here. Allow me to introduce typical tsundere character number 761 and typical calm and collected character number 828 yeah they are basic characters that don't have much depth to them at all but again it is a hentai game so I don't really know what was expecting.

Last but no means least and the reason the game has this infamous reputation is the 18+ scenes although they are not animated like Nekopara I would say they are nicely put together but I suppose the great artwork is the reason for this. They're okay. And are honestly worth both your time and use of hand cream.

So even though I see Sakura Swim Club as a some what mediocre game I can't say that I wouldn't reccomend it as it's a hentai game and those scenes aren't bad in all honesty. The only other thing to note is the music apart from 2 tracks THAT WILL DRIVE YOU INSANE AFTER BEING PLAYED OVER AND OVER the soundtrack is pretty good too. So for what this game is it ain't half bad especially consdering all of the other shit that gets put up on steam these days. 

Now if you excuse me I am going to get the trading cards craft the badge and have friends message me as to what the hell I have been playing for the next 3 months.
